intro: Matthiola lacera, commonly known as the desert stock, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Matthiola lacera is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun.
